sentences.en: At such an old age, I can't wear such flashy clothes.
sentences.cn: 我这么大岁数了, 可穿不了这么花不棱登的衣服.

sentences.en: Caroline felt the value of the true ore, and knew the deception of the flashy dross.
sentences.cn: 卡罗琳辨别出了真金的价值, 知道那种炫耀的铁渣只有迷惑人的外表.

sentences.en: Do you have a flashy sense of style?
Envying those flashy celebrities on the cover page of fashion magazines?
sentences.cn: 您是否对杂志封面里风情万千的明星而艳羡不已?

sentences.en: He drove around the town in a flashy sports - car.
sentences.cn: 他驾驶一辆外表华丽的赛车在镇上兜风.

sentences.en: He is man with artful speech and flashy manners.
He tries to impress the girls by wearing flashy socks and jackets.
sentences.cn: 他穿着艳丽的袜子和外套,试图以此吸引女孩子们的注意.

sentences.en: His book is freighted with pompous words and flashy but empty concepts.
sentences.cn: 他的书充满了冠冕堂皇的词语,以及听上去时髦却内容空洞的理念.

sentences.en: I just want a good reliable car, nothing flashy.
sentences.cn: 我只要一辆性能可靠的轿车，不要华而不实的那种。

sentences.en: No man was more incapable of flashy make - believe than Mr. Casaubon.
sentences.cn: 卡苏明先生与别人不同,从不弄虚作假.

sentences.en: Streetball often features spectacular dunks and alley - oops, flashy dribbling and trash talking.
sentences.cn: 街球的特色常常在于触目惊心的灌篮和空中接力 、 花哨的运球以及挑衅语言.

sentences.en: Such women as he had known were of nearly one type, selfish, ignorant, flashy.
sentences.cn: 他以往认识的女性几乎都属于同一类型:自私 、 无知 、 俗艳.

sentences.en: That new car is Graham down to the ground - all bright and flashy.
sentences.cn: 那辆新车对格雷厄姆最适合了 —— 光彩夺目.

sentences.en: What he called & quot ; Kongfu & quot ; was in fact just some flashy postures.
sentences.cn: 他所谓的“功夫”其实都是些花把式.

sentences.en: You cannot expect a scoring, flashy superstar from him.
sentences.cn: 你不能从他身上期待得分, 或者巨星的光辉什么的.

words.tran_cn: 恶俗；灿烂地；瞬间地；华而不实
发出闪光之物；闪光装置

trans.tran_cn: 浮华的，俗丽的，闪光的，瞬间的，昙花一现的，（脾气等）暴烈的
trans.tran_en: someone who is flashy wears expensive clothes,  jewellery  etc in a way that is intended to be impressive – used to show disapproval
